result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: passport form - defendant does not have one
Preliminary hearing on November 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with individuals/Colonial Apartments/Alumni Club listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court. Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) prior to being released from custody/within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

1:59 PM Defendant Jarvis J Harris in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Jarvis J Harris. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defendant states he does not have a passport.Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Motion and order to seal victim/witness identification key
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
